page.title: 07WADES FARM, ADELAIDE (ii)
page.content: In winter,the land has to be drained and dykes carry the excess water into the River Lark.In summer,the crops have to be irrigated using large booms which move across the fields. To prevent disease and pests,the crops are sprayed during the growing season. When the land was divided between four farmers, one hundred people worked on it but now there are only six full-ti me tractor drivers.Seasonal labour includes fourteen women planting celery,twenty-five on potato planting and two students.The hours are Summer 7am to 6pm and Winter 7.30am to 4pm.The workers are paid approximately Â£3.16 an hour,about Â£161 a week.In years to come,Greens Farms will supply a large percentage of Britain's vegetables.Wades Farm modifies machinery to suit its conditions.
